title: Is there anything at the top of Jordan Peterson's Kingdom of Heaven Axiomatic Hill Part 2
description:
Part 2 of looking at Part 4 of Jordan Peterson's Easter Video https://youtu.be/xPIanlF6IwM 

Part 1 on YouTube https://youtu.be/uJYbU9yMPLE

Sacrifice, the future, "God" and the social contract are all connected, but we need a real foundation and a real connection to that foundation for a civilization to endure. The imago dei is that foundation in part 4 but the question remains if the foundation leads to anything. "Shoulder the heavy burden of your cross and drag it up hill to the kingdom of God" is heroic and fills us with the experience of meaning and may make the world a better place but is there actually a consummation? 

JBP and Heidegger on Reddit https://www.reddit.com/r/badphilosophy/comments/7rlbus/martin_heidegger_concisely_explained_by_jordan/ 

the text of Easter Message 1 https://jordanbpeterson.com/philosophy/on-the-ark-of-the-covenant-the-cathedral-and-the-cross-easter-message-i/ 

Charles Taylor A Secular Age https://www.amazon.com/Secular-Age-Charles-TAYLOR-ebook/dp/B002KFZLK2 

Peter Hitchens Rage Against God https://www.amazon.com/Rage-Against-God-Atheism-Faith-ebook/dp/B003EUGFY8 

Thabiti Anyabwile, With Ta-Nehisi Coates  https://youtu.be/Gton4je7T_Y

For the audio podcast mirror on Podbean http://paulvanderklay.podbean.com/

To listen to this on ITunes https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/paul-vanderklays-podcast/id1394314333 

If you need the RSS feed for your podcast player https://paulvanderklay.podbean.com/feed/ 

To support this channel/podcast on Patreon https://www.patreon.com/paulvanderklay
